entry.title: Telemedicine Process Automation
entry.content:
Telemedicine Process Automation

Customer

A Supplier of Mobile Cardiac Outpatient Telemetry that provides the next-generation ambulatory cardiac monitoring service with beat-to-beat, real time analysis, automatic arrhythmia detection and wireless ECG transmission. It helps clinicians prevent morbidity, mortality and disability with rapid diagnosis and treatment of patients with cardiovascular disease.

Objectives and Solution

The project was to automate the process of ECG signal decoding transmitted via phone landlines and integrate solution with existent patient monitoring system. Signal could be recorded in noisy place with distortions caused by landlines equipment. Also target was to successfully process no less than 70% of all records.

  • Applied numerical analysis to the problem and created mathematical model for signal processing
  • Integrated with existing patient monitoring system through XML Web Services technology

Project highlights

  • Successfully designed and implemented self adaptive demodulator algorithm
  • Through reverse engineering technical documentation for supported cardiac monitors was re-defined and corrected
  • Application UX was designed for maximum personnel efficiency and fully supports control via keyboard

entry.title: Healthcare Center
entry.content:
Comfortsleep

Customer

Healthcare center located in New Jersey.

Objective and solution

Customer had legacy application that partially implemented existing workflows. System was inconvenient and not flexible enough for further support.

The problem was to reengineer legacy software, automate and rewise existing workflows including:

  • Implement assets order management
  • Automate equipment trasfering between warehouses
  • Create CRM-like system that bridges between physicians patients and insurance companies
  • Integrate with equipment usage monitoring third party systems

Along with automation there was a task to increase effectiveness and perfromance of the new system.

Solution:

  • Several webportals were developed and cross integrated
  • Extensibility was ensured by service-oriented architecture
  • Existing data was migrated by means of custom built tool
  • Replication of data across warehouses significantly increased overral performance

Project highlights

  • Perfect mix of local involvement and remote communication among team members located in different development locations
  • Appliance of continuous integration and unit testing practices significantly reduced costs spent on testing
  • UX design and implementation time was greatly reduced with the assistance rich component framework
  • Customer has a long-term plans to extend functionality onto mobile platform

entry.title: Brewery Marketing Activities
entry.content:
Brewery Marketing Activities

Customer

One of the largest American-owned breweries.

Objective and solution

The application had to be utilized to place orders for promotional items. Orders may be placed by authorized associates via friendly web-based user interface. The application implies the back-end which is utilized by the application administrators to manage orders, users and other specific information.

Solution:

  • Application was built on top of ASP.NET
  • Integrated with online purchase service to make it possible to process payment in various ways
  • Employed Microsoft Reporting Services to generate sales reports

Project highlights

  • Development boosted by 3rd party components library
  • Successfully ported rich UI experience onto tablet devices
  • Customer saved resources that were spent on marketing activities

entry.title: Airlines Luggage Tags
entry.content:
Airlines Luggage Tags

Customer

A large airline based in California, with operations throughout the western United States and western Canada, as well as into Mexico.

Objective and solution

Company wanted to create online service that will allow customers to create custom luggage tags. Along with this service customer required:

  • Order management backend software
  • Integration with several printing companies

Solution:

  • ASP.NET powered site
  • Extensive use of JavaScript
  • Printing assets preprocessing and generation done with scheduler controlled Windows Services

Project highlights

  • Using the homegrown rapid prototyping framework first working prototype was launched in 1 week
  • Cross-browser WYSIWYG editor written fully in JavaScript
  • Service is W3C standards compliant
